authors.name: Laura  Smith
authors.affiliation: Department of Clinical and Movement Neurosciences, Queen Square Institute of Neurology, University College London (UCL)

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"egmof","text":"Synthetic substrate can be used at acidic pH (pH 4.1) to assess activity of lysosomal hydrolases, β-Galactosidase and β-Hexosaminidase. The substrate is cleaved by β-Galactosidase and β-Hexosaminidase  and produces a fluorescent product proportional to activity.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"33p8c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dghn","text":"Buffers: McIlvaine citrate–phosphate (MV), pH 5.4 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvc13","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmns8","text":"Substrates: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atq9s","text":"- β-Galactosidase: 4-Methylumbelliferyl β-D-galactopyranoside (Sigma M1633)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"erkh8","text":"- β-hexosaminidase: 4-Methylumbelliferyl N-acetyl-β-D-glucosaminide (Sigma M2133):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7su3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"espgr","text":"Standard:4–methylumbelliferone (MWt. 176) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40f68","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1iagm","text":"Stopping solution:0.25 M glycine buffer pH 10.4 reagent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2i00l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsitn","text":"Inhibitors: CBE (Sigma 5424) and DNJ (Enzo BML-SL230-005).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ojj7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5reun","text":"McIlvaine citrate–phosphate (MV):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jih5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11i84","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv6ma","text":" GCase + NaT GCase HEX and β-gal pH 5.4 pH 4.5 pH 4.1 0.1 M citric acid 44 ml 54 ml 30 ml 0.2 M Na2HPO4 56 ml 46 ml 20 ml, then 1:1            ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":262}],"data":{}},{"key":"96hk3","text":"0.1M citric acid monohydrate (Mwt = 210.14 g/mol) – 5.2535 g in 250 mL dH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95sck","text":"0.2M Na2HPO4 (Mwt = 141.9 g/mol) – 7.098 g in 250 mL dH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","0_3":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","3_3":""},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":[127,110],"data":[[" ","pH 4.1"],[" 0.1 M citric acid ","30 ml"],[" 0.2 M Na2HPO4 ","20 ml, then 1:1"]],"guid":"72BCBB54C70611ECB7380A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[[" ","pH 4.1"],[" 0.1 M citric acid ","30 ml"],[" 0.2 M Na2HPO4 ","20 ml, then 1:1"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9930k","text":"β-Galactosidase: 4-Methylumbelliferyl β-D-galactopyranoside (Sigma M1633): ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":75}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a412f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d98m3","text":"Take 3.4 mg mg in 10 mL dH2O and heat at 80’C until dissolved (0.34mg/ml)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahof3","text":"Make up in two bijou tubes; vortex to dissolve or sonnicate and store at -20.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dk3k1","text":"For each experiment, heat at 60-80’C in oven to ensure all powder is solubilised.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26oeu","text":"Standard: 4–methylumbelliferone (MWt. 176) (Sigma M1381):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":57}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkle3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27ao7","text":"Desired concentration is 1 nmol in 200 uL aliquots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dctmu","text":"Take 2 mg in 1.5 mL dH2O, then do a 1:1000 dilution in dH2O to give a 0.2ug/200ul concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s0fu","text":"Aliquot into 200 uls in eppendorfs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3o98","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92v48","text":"When using in experiment, add 1 mL glycine buffer to Eppendorf and load 200 uL into each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8m8iu","text":"Stopping buffer: 0.25 M glycine buffer pH 10.4 reagent:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6t59c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85qms","text":"Make up 64g NaOH in 200 mL dH2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8c0e","text":"Make up 150g glycine in 1600 mL dH2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dul0","text":"When all mixed, add both together.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs19a","text":"Ensure pH is 10.4 and make up to 2 L with dH2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"29lvt","text":"37oC water bath","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":2,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gl9k","text":"Plate reader, excitation 360 nm, emission 460 nm, sensitivity=50","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7lf2j","text":"Enzyme:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6so34","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6omvd","text":"Samples are resuspended in water or 1% (v/v) TX-100 in PBS. For TX-100 lysis, cells incubated on ice for 15 mins and debris/nuclei removed by centrifugation at 17, 000 x g, 10 min, 4 °C. Supernatant containing GBA enzyme placed in fresh tube. All samples are sonicated in water bath for 1 minute. Protein concentration measured with BCA protein assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83glp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8eh1j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bbut3","text":"Dilute in water a portion of the sonicate to give a protein concentration of 0.25 - 4 mg / ml.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d19gh","text":"Set up mix in eppendorf tubes for each well as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bejt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36cbs","text":"Make a master mix e.g multiply by number of wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ba95f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3i4kh","text":"B-gal:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2m6th","text":"20µl B-gal/HEX buffer pH 4.1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4ogj","text":"10µl B-gal substrate solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebdqp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnbh5","text":"B-hex:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63vdh","text":"20µl B-gal/HEX buffer pH 4.1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"570nh","text":"10µl B-gal substrate solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ekrmg","text":"Add 10 µl diluted enzyme sample in to duplicate wells of a 96 well plate. (Note: may have to optimise volume of sample loaded depending on sensitivity of fluorescence machine used).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1cgl","text":"Add 10 µl of lysis buffer used (water of TX-100 in PBS) to duplicate wells to serve as substrate blanks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1etru","text":"Add 30 µl of reaction mixture to each well","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1j61h","text":"Add 200 µL stopping solution to each well ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1hc2m","text":"Standard:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eq83c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atn85","text":"To 1 nmol 4–methylumbelliferone standard in 200 µl H2O add ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":52,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cuvf","text":"1.0 ml stopping reagent.Mix and 200 ml to empty wells to serve as a fluorescence standard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98ju9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cs7ob","text":"β-hexosaminidase: 4-Methylumbelliferyl N-acetyl-β-D-glucosaminide (Sigma M2133): ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":81}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d1f5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nhu6","text":"Take 27 mg in 10 ml dH2O and heat at 80’C until dissolved (2.71mg/ml)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ejdf","text":"Make up in two bijou tubes of 5 ml and store at -20’C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g5d5","text":"For each experiment, heat at 60-80’C in oven to ensure all powder is solubilised.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: In Vitro B-galactosidase and B-hexosaminidase Activity Assay (Total Cell Lysate)
title_html: In Vitro B-galactosidase and B-hexosaminidase Activity Assay (Total Cell Lysate)
